title: Palmyra
summary: Palmyra (/ˌpælˈmaɪrə/; Palmyrene: 𐡶𐡣𐡬𐡥𐡴 () Tadmor; Arabic: تَدْمُر‎ Tadmur) is an ancient Semitic city in present-day Homs Governorate, Syria. Archaeological finds date back to the Neolithic period, and documents first mention the city in the early second millennium BC. Palmyra changed hands on a number of occasions between different empires before becoming a subject of the Roman Empire in the first century AD.
